title.narrative: Relevant stakeholders work towards a better understanding of safeguards

target.value: -Jointly with the Anti-Torture Initiative. create a structure. comprised of a Steering Committee. drafting groups and an Advisory Council. in charge of developing the set of standards -Accompanying State authorities to strengthen the implementation of procedural safeguards in Brazil. Madagascar and Thailand -Strengthening the capacities of NPMs in monitoring the implementation of safeguards in Kirghizstan. Paraguay and Mexico

actual.value: -A Steering Committee of 15 high-level experts from varied disciplines. backgrounds and origins has been created. It has met twice in Rio de Janeiro and Tunis where they have been able to mobilise States and key stakeholders through bilateral briefings and national events. The Steering Committee is complemented by a drafting group of 11 experts and an Advisory Council of 43 members -Key States have been briefed about the initiative; have recognized the need for such guidelines and shown interest to contribute to ensuring its endorsement. -The APT ensured political commitment in Brazil. Thaïland and Madagascar

title.narrative: NPMs monitor a broader variety of places of detention
Increased number of NPMs monitoring regularly non-traditional places of detention

target.value: 4 extra NPMs monitor a broader variety of places of detention

actual.value: -The Mexican NPM published a thematic report following visits in psychiatric institutions. -The French NPM included the monitoring of psychiatric institutions as a priority in their plan of action. -The NPM of Kirghizstan monitors regularly psychiatric institutions. -The Italian NPM started regular visits in social care homes. -For the first time. NPMs and civil society organisations from 30 countries of Europe and Central Asia exchanged and discussed strategies to address immigration detention. during an APT/OSCE conference in Milan. Italy. -In his thematic report of February 2018 on migration related torture. the Special Rapporteur on Torture (SPT) called for full-access to NPMs

title.narrative: NPM understand and address situations of vulnerabilities in detention
Increased number of NPMs that issue thematic reports and/or include specific chapters to their annual reports on vulnerabilities in detention.

target.value: Production and publication of a practical guide on monitoring LGBTI persons in detention.

actual.value: The APT launched its guide “Towards the Effective Protection of LGBTI Persons Deprived of Liberty” in December (450 downloads of the guide in the first week). It is available in English and Portuguese and will be available in March 2019 in French and Spanish.
